entities: ISIL (Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant)
reporting_cycle: Member States to report to the Committee within 120 days
summary:
26. The Council reminds Member States of their obligation to prevent the supply, sale, or transfer of arms to listed individuals and entities, including ISIL and ANF.

27. The Council calls on States to prevent the transfer of arms, particularly man-portable surface-to-air missiles, if there is a reasonable suspicion that they would be obtained by ISIL, ANF, or other Al-Qaida-associated individuals and entities.

28. The Council reaffirms that the asset freeze applies to financial and economic resources used to support Al-Qaida and other listed individuals and entities.

29. Member States are called upon to report to the Committee within 120 days on measures taken to comply with the imposed measures.

30. The Analytical Support and Sanctions Monitoring Team is requested to assess the impact of these measures and report to the Committee within 150 days, and to incorporate reporting on the impact into their regular reports.

31. The Security Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
